DOC.HEAD: 3-Week-Old Who Disappeared From Hospital Found
Eds: New throughout with second arrest, quote from investigator; no pickup.
DOC.TEXT: Two women accused of taking a 3-week-old boy boy from a hospital were charged with kidnapping Friday, hours after the infant was found unharmed in an apartment, police said. Ellis Lyles Jr., born Nov. 28 at the hospital, was to be released Thursday night after a three-day hospitalization for gastrointestinal problems, said hospital president Michael H. Sussman. He was found, safe and apparently well-cared for, at the apartment of Sonia Rodriguez early Friday, hours after he was reported missing from the pediatric unit at Norwegian-American Hospital, said Detective John McKenna. Rodriguez, a 40-year-old mother of four, was charged with aggravated kidnapping, as was Carmen Calderon, 20, said Detective Philip Ducar. ``Apparently because they didn't see any parent of the baby for two or three days, they thought the baby was abandoned, so they were going to take him home and raise him as their own,'' Ducar said. Rodriguez smuggled the baby out under her coat and Calderon was a lookout for security guards and took some supplies to care for the baby, Ducar said. The two women were in custory pending bail hearings. The baby, the son of Janice Holliday and Ellis Lyles Sr., was last seen by hospital staff shortly before 8 p.m. Thursday, the hospital said. Sussman said the infant was readmitted Dec. 18 with acute gastroenteritis, an inflammation of the stomach and intestines.
